Data Structures

struct  ThaiFontHint

Detailed Description

Renderer for Thai text. Will draw correct diacritics, tonemarks, etc.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum ThaiTextRenderer::CharacterClass
 

Thai character classes. Used to determine each Thai character's type, which is used to verify the correct syntax of a Thai text and how to render character combinations. Every character belongs to one class; the mapping is done via g_charclass_table in ThaiTextRenderer.cpp.

Enumerator:
Ctrl 
Non 
Cons 
LV 
FV1 
FV2 
FV3 
BV1 
BV2 
BD 
Tone 
AD1 
AD2 
AD3 
AV1 
AV2 
AV3 

enum ThaiTextRenderer::RenderType
 

Used to determine whether and how to render character combinations.

Enumerator:
Render 
Compose  render immediately
Control  needs to be combined with preceding character(s)

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN ThaiTextRenderer::BeginGlyphRetrieval (  const WCHAR *  text_start,
const Font &  font,
TextAttr  text_attr
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Apart from things performed in

See also:
AbstractTextRenderer::BeginGlyphRetrieval, also also performs the following tasks if the font has been changed since the last call to the Thai text renderer: (1) Retrieves the appropriate font hinting information from

FontConfig::GetThaiFontHints. (2) Constructs glyphs w/o below diacritics for 0x0E0D and 0x0E10.

Reimplemented from AbstractTextRenderer.

Size ThaiTextRenderer::GetGlyph (  const WCHAR *  cur_text_pos,
const WCHAR *  substitution_char,
INT  char_count,
GlyphPtr  glyph,
INT &  parsed_glyphs,
BOOLEAN &  is_diacritic
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Get the glyph for a character. Will return the glyph except if

See also:
ThaiTextRenderer::PrepareText replaced 0x0E0D and 0x0E10 with 0x0E5C and 0x0E5D, respectively. In these two cases, glyphs for 0x0E0D and 0x0E10 with their below diacritics removed will be returned.
For a detailed explanation of parameters etc. please see
See also:
AbstractTextRenderer::GetGlyph.

Implements AbstractTextRenderer.
